member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlText.SplitText(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Splits this text node into two text nodes at the specified offset and inserts the new text node into the tree as a sibling that immediately follows this node.
member.param: The number of characters at which to split this text node into two nodes, starting from zero.

member.name: T:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlText
member.summary: Represents the text content of an element or attribute.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the data, in Unicode characters.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the node data depending on the node type.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.SubstringData(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a substring of the full string from the specified range.
member.param: Specifies the offset, in characters, from the beginning of the string. An offset of zero indicates copying from the start of the data.
Specifies the number of characters to retrieve from the specified offset.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.ReplaceData(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the specified number of characters with the supplied string.
member.param: The offset, in characters, at which to start replacing string data.
The number of characters to replace.
The new data that replaces the old string data.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.InsertData(System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a string at the specified offset.
member.param: The offset, in characters, at which to insert the supplied string data.
The data to be inserted into the existing string.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.DeleteData(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes specified data.
member.param: The offset, in characters, at which to start deleting the string data.
The number of characters to delete.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData.AppendData(System.String)
member.summary: Appends the supplied string to the existing string data.
member.param: The data to be appended to the existing string.

member.name: T:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlCharacterData
member.summary: Provides text manipulation methods that are used by several objects.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets the previous sibling of the node in the parent's child list.
member.result: The left sibling of this node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets the next sibling of the node in the parent's child list.
member.result: The right sibling of this node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.NodeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the XML Document Object Model (DOM) node type, which determines valid values and whether the node can have child nodes.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.NodeName
member.summary: Returns the qualified name for attribute, document type, element, entity, or notation nodes. Returns a fixed string for all other node types.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.NamespaceUri
member.summary: Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the namespace.
member.result: The Uri for the namespace. This refers to the uuu portion of the namespace declaration xmlns:nnn=uuu.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.LocalName
member.summary: Gets the local name, which is the local part of a qualified name. This is called the local part in Namespaces in XML.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last child node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.FirstChild
member.summary: Gets the first child node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.ChildNodes
member.summary: Gets a list of children in the current node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the list of attributes of this node.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.ParentNode
member.summary: Gets the parent node of the node instance.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.OwnerDocument
member.summary: Returns the root of the document that contains the node.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.ReplaceChild(PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode,PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Replaces the specified old child node with the supplied new child node.
member.param: The new child that is to replace the old child. If null, the referenceChild parameter is removed without a replacement.
The old child that is to be replaced by the new child.
member.returns: The old child that is replaced. If null, no object is created.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.RemoveChild(PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Removes the specified child node from the list of children and returns it.
member.param: The child node to be removed from the list of children of this node.
member.returns: The removed child node. If null, the childNode object is not removed.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.Normalize
member.summary: Normalizes all descendant elements by combining two or more adjacent text nodes into one unified text node.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.InsertBefore(PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode,PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Inserts a child node to the left of the specified node, or at the end of the list.
member.param: The address of the new node to be inserted. The node passed here must be a valid child of the current XML DOM document node. For example, if the current node is an attribute, you cannot pass another attribute in the newChild parameter, because an attribute cannot have an attribute as a child. If newChild is a DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT node type, all its children are inserted in order before referenceChild. If newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed before it is reinserted before the referenceChild node. Read-only nodes, such as NODE_DOCUMENT_TYPE and NODE_ENTITY nodes, cannot be passed in the newChild parameter.

The reference node. The node specified is where the newChild node is to be inserted to the left as the preceding sibling in the child list. The node passed here must be a either a child node of the current node or null. If the value is null, the newChild node is inserted at the end of the child list. If the referenceChild node is not a child of the current node, an error is returned.
member.returns: On success, the child node that was inserted. If null, no object is created.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.HasChildNodes
member.summary: Determines whether a node has children.
member.returns: True if this node has children; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.CloneNode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones a new node.
member.param: A flag that indicates whether to recursively clone all nodes that are descendants of this node. If true, this method creates a clone of the complete tree below this node. If false, this method clones this node and its attributes only.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode.AppendChild(PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode)
member.summary: Appends a new node as the last child of the node.
member.param: The new child node to be appended to the end of the list of children of this node.
member.returns: The new child node successfully appended to the list. If null, no object is created.

member.name: T:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNode
member.summary: Contains information for the entire Document Object Model. This interface represents a single node in the document tree. While all objects that implement this interface expose methods for dealing with children, not all objects that implement this interface may have children.

member.name: P:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSerializer.InnerText
member.summary: Gets and sets the text from inside the XML.
member.result: The text from inside the XML. Returns an empty string if there is no text.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSerializer.GetXml
member.summary: Returns the XML representation of the node and all its descendants.
member.returns: The XML representation of the node and all its descendants.

member.name: T:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSerializer
member.summary: Encapsulates the methods needed to serialize a DOM tree or subtree to a string representation.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSelector.SelectSingleNodeNS(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the first matching node.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expression.

Contains a string that specifies the namespaces to use in XPath expressions when it is necessary to define new namespaces externally. Namespaces are defined in the XML style, as a space-separated list of namespace declaration attributes. You can use this property to set the default namespace as well.
member.returns: The first node that matches the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes match the expression, this method returns a null value.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSelector.SelectSingleNode(System.String)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the first matching node.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expression.
member.returns: The first node that matches the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes match the expression, the method returns a null value.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSelector.SelectNodesNS(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the list of matching nodes as an XmlNodeList.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expresssion.

Contains a string that specifies namespaces for use in XPath expressions when it is necessary to define new namespaces externally. Namespaces are defined in the XML style, as a space-separated list of namespace declaration attributes. You can use this property to set the default namespace as well.
member.returns: The collection of nodes selected by applying the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes are selected, returns an empty collection.

member.name: M:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSelector.SelectNodes(System.String)
member.summary: Applies the specified pattern-matching operation to this node's context and returns the list of matching nodes as an XmlNodeList.
member.param: Specifies an XPath expression.
member.returns: The collection of nodes selected by applying the given pattern-matching operation. If no nodes are selected, this method returns an empty collection.

member.name: T:PhoneSupportInterfaces.IXmlNodeSelector
member.summary: Encapsulates the methods needed to execute XPath queries on an XML DOM tree or subtree.

member.name: T:PhoneSupportInterfaces.NodeType
member.summary: The type of an IXmlNode, as returned by the NodeType property.

member.summary: Non-significant whitespace -- no special node type, may appear as IXmlText

member.name: F:PhoneSupportInterfaces.NodeType.SignificantWhitespaceNode
member.summary: Significant whitespace -- no special node type, may appear as IXmlText
